entries.title: Russian citizens continue to be punished for expressing anti-war sentiment
entries.description: People are being fined on an almost daily basis, mainly under the law on 'bringing the army into disrepute.'

entries.title: Giorgia Meloni launches her Mediterranean policy in Algiers
entries.description: Eager to increase its gas imports from Africa, Italy wants to become an 'energy hub' between Europe and the southern Mediterranean.

entries.title: Germany to provide Ukraine with Leopard tanks, according to reports
entries.description: Germany has been reluctant to send tanks to Ukraine. The US is also moving closer to providing Ukraine with Abrams M1 tanks.

entries.title: LVMH abandons 100 million euro project at a prestigious French university
entries.description: The luxury group will not set up a research laboratory on land adjacent to the prestigious engineering school,  a project which students against protested last year.

entries.title: Belgium threatens to expel three Irani citizens
entries.description: After their applications for asylum were rejected, Ali Aghaei Khaneghahi, Hesam Alireza and Mohammad Reza Hamian refused to board flights to Turkey on Monday.

entries.title: US sues Google over dominance of online ad market
entries.description: The US Justice Department sued Google on Tuesday for its dominance of the online advertising market.

entries.title: Classified documents found at former US VP Pence's home
entries.description: A 'small number' of classified documents were found in former vice president Mike Pence's home in Indiana. The Justice Department is already investigating the presence of classified documents in the homes of Joe Biden and Donald Trump.

entries.title: Iranian smugglers sentenced to prison after family drown trying to cross Channel
entries.description: In October 2020, a husband, wife, and their three young children drowned while trying to reach England. The defendants were convicted of manslaughter.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Corruption scandal undermines Zelensky's government
entries.description: Several senior Ukrainian officials involved in corruption scandals, including the deputy defense minister, have resigned or been dismissed.

entries.title: France's pension reform is also much about the EU
entries.description: In Emmanuel Macron's mind, making the French work more is consistent with his desire to make France and the European Union more autonomous, journalist Françoise Fressoz writes in her column.

entries.title: 'Doomsday Clock' moves closest ever to midnight
entries.description: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists said it was advancing the hands of the clock by 10 seconds this year due in part to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Confusion in Berlin weighs on Franco-German relations
entries.description: Divisions within the German government damage the relationship between Paris and Berlin.

entries.title: 2023 Oscars: 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' tops noms with 11
entries.description: The multiverse sci-fi indie hit 'Everything Everywhere All At Once' on Tuesday topped the Oscar nominations with 11, as Hollywood formally kicked off the race to the Academy Awards on March 12.

entries.title: Pension reform: French government emphasizes the importance of 'justice' and 'progress'
entries.description: An impact study of the government bill states that it allows for the strengthening of 'solidarity and equity between insured persons,' while the unions denounce its 'unfair' and 'severe' nature.

entries.title: Diplomatic crisis intensifies between Turkey and Sweden
entries.description: Provocative actions against Turkey are increasing in Sweden in reaction to President Erdogan, who is continuing to block the Scandinavian country's accession to NATO.

entries.title: French Nuclear Safety Authority considers extending reactors beyond 60 years of operation
entries.description: For the first time, the body is insisting on the need to take better account of the long-term consequences of climate change on nuclear power plants.

entries.title: Paris Men's fashion: What you'll be wearing next winter
entries.description: At the Parisian men's collections for fall-winter 2023-2024, pragmatic looks that can go from the catwalk to the street reigned.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: With heavy weapons, NGOs offer crucial help
entries.description: Recent legislation allows Ukrainian charities to import such weapons.

entries.title: Several senior Ukraine officials resign amid corruption allegations
entries.description: The announcements came as the Defense Ministry was shaken by a food procurement scandal and the presidency warned of tough anti-graft measures.

entries.title: Demography: Denying its fragility will not help China
entries.description: The world's most populous country has seen its population decline for the first time in 61 years.

entries.title: UK Conservatives mired in a series of scandals
entries.description: The Tories are a long way from the image of integrity that Rishi Sunak sought to project.

entries.title: Pakistan's power restored a day after massive outage
entries.description: A massive power breakdown across Pakistan affected most of the country's 220 million residents, including in the mega cities of Karachi and Lahore.

entries.title: Poland officially asks Germany to send Leopard tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Poland must have Berlin's permission to send the German-made armaments on to Ukraine under Germany's war weapons control act.

entries.title: 'One of the world's cruelest migrant smugglers' arrested in Sudan
entries.description: After escaping from an Ethiopian court in 2021, 39-year-old Kidane Zekarias Habtemariam, whose network stretched from Somalia to Libya, was finally arrested.

entries.title: Sabotage shuts down Paris train station for entire day
entries.description: A fire, started deliberately according to officials, broke out during Tuesday morning rush hour in Gare de l'Est affecting tens of millions of commuters.

entries.title: France repatriates over 40 women and children from Syria
entries.description: This is the third major return of French citizens from the Middle Eastern country, but France still refuses to implement a blanket repatriation.

entries.title: Macron still expects Burkina leader Traoré to publicly ask for withdrawal of French troops
entries.description: According to its government spokesperson, Ouagadougou requested the removal of French troops on January 23. However, Paris is demanding that this request must be confirmed by the head of the junta.

entries.title: 'We're going to save so much time': ChatGPT users play God with AI
entries.description: Ever since they discovered the artificial intelligence application that can generate text on a range of subjects, they have been wondering if they could make Chat GPT do their work for them. But they are also afraid that it might end up taking their jobs.

entries.title: France's elusive promise: Cutting nuclear power to 50% of electricity production
entries.description: At first, France planned to cut the share of nuclear power in its electricity production to 50% by 2025. Then, 2035. Now, the target looks set to be scrapped altogether.

entries.title: New shootings rock California as police probe dance hall killings
entries.description: A 67-year-old man was taken into custody Monday after he shot dead 7 people at two farms near Half Moon Bay, near San Francisco. The twin shootings occured less than 48 hours after a 72-year old man killed 11 people in Monterey Park, near Los Angeles.

entries.title: France backs down on reauthorizing 'bee-killing' neonicotinoids
entries.description: The French Minister of Agriculture Marc Fesneau announced on Monday he would not extend the exemption allowing beet growers to use these banned pesticides, following a recent EU court ruling.

entries.title: How commodity traders in Switzerland are benefiting from the war
entries.description: According to the NGO Public Eye, the profits of fossil and agricultural commodity traders have soared since the beginning of the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Brazil pins murders of Dom Phillips and Bruno Pereira on alleged drug lord
entries.description: Police believe Ruben da Silva Villar ordered the murders of the UK reporter and the Brazilian Indigenous expert. The alleged drug lord has been in police custody since December, but his identity was difficult to pin down as he carried three sets of identity papers.

entries.title: At the Musée Soulages, an exhibition on RCR Arquitectes' stunning minimalism
entries.description: The Catalan winners of the 2017 Pritzker Prize are honored in Rodez in the museum they designed, with models showing their most emblematic historical projects, which reveal the landscape.
